lexUnit.name: need.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: require (something) because it is essential or very important rather than just desirable.

sentence.text: ` I needed practical help , " she says .
I did n't really need the money but I tried to hold her up .
He needs reassurance .
We need him urgently at Swinbrook . "
` We desperately need a nursery in this area , " she said .

The eastern states say they badly need an extra 4,500 judges , 1,000 state prosecutors and 1,300 lawyers -- not least to deal with the hundreds of thousands of property claims flooding in from the west .
We need our ordinary grumbling members to keep us on our toes .
A banquet is needed ; the cooks have to prepare a menu and the food .
You need £100 in your account to qualify for free banking .
` It 'll be very heavy , so we 'll need lots of people .
Now listen , I need an hour 's kip and a bath , so I 'll settle for the bath .
Now , Labour needs a further swing of eight per cent to be sure of an overall majority but six per cent would make it the biggest single party .
She felt as if she would never need sleep again .
The centre needs a choirmaster or mistress for its choir , the “ Visionaires ” , and volunteers to aid keep - fit , craft and cookery classes .
Jan 's needed for an urgent meeting tomorrow .
Still , that experienced third was the battalion 's backbone ; the men whose voices would stiffen the ranks and give the Colonel the victory he needed in his opening engagement .
I need a strong man to protect me .
, We 'll need a jacket to go with that , " Marie says .
“ We need them now ! ”
The boy needs that .
I think we might need the blinds down for this , otherwise it 's going to glare on the screen .
Generally , though , he needs more space if he is to cover so much ground in adequate detail .
